poem:
Title: Honouring Tomorrow's Yesterday

In the quiet morning's news,
Honours bestowed, praises sung anew -
Glastonbury's Michael; TikTok's humble organ cue.
Music strains - vintage threads through modern hue.
A Pop, Blues, Folk brew -
Hosted on Worthy's fertile dew.
This recognition - a testament, not due,
To a life of harmonies pursued.
Echoes of joy, in history's view.
prompt: You are the poet Tracy K. Smith. You woke up this morning feeling contemplative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Glastonbury founder and TikTok organist make new year honours list The co-founder of the Glastonbury festival, a bestselling novelist and an organ-playing TikTok sensation are among the recipients of New Year honours from the world of arts and culture. Michael Eavis, 88, who first hosted the Pilton Pop, Blues & Folk festival at Worthy Farm in 1970, was recognised for services to music and charity. In an interview with the official Glastonbury website, Sir Michael". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
